title: Vocabulary Drill
goal: Solidify all 12 gismu through intensive practice and self-testing.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Grammar quick-check — fill in the blanks:

  1. ___ marks the start of the selbri. (answer: cu)
  2. ___ separates sentences. (answer: .i)
  3. mi means ___. (answer: I/me)
  4. do means ___. (answer: you)
  5. ti means ___. (answer: this, near speaker)
  6. ta means ___. (answer: that, near listener)

Now say aloud: mi cu tavla do .i do cu prami mi

(I talk to you. You love me.)

New Material (5-7 min)

No New Concepts Today

Today is pure practice. You've learned all the building blocks:

  • 12 gismu (root words)
  • 5 cmavo (mi, do, ti, ta, cu, .i)
  • Bridi structure (sumti + selbri + sumti)
  • Place structures (each gismu has labeled slots)

Now it's time to drill until these are automatic.

The 12 Gismu — Full Reference

Study this table. Cover the English column and test yourself.

Lojban Place Structure English
prami x1 loves x2 love
klama x1 goes to x2 from x3 via x4 by x5 go
tavla x1 talks to x2 about x3 in language x4 talk
citka x1 eats x2 eat
pinxe x1 drinks x2 drink
cadzu x1 walks on x2 walk
ciska x1 writes x2 on x3 with x4 write
tcidu x1 reads x2 from x3 read
sipna x1 sleeps sleep
melbi x1 is beautiful to x2 by standard x3 beautiful
xamgu x1 is good for x2 by standard x3 good
xlali x1 is bad for x2 by standard x3 bad

Memory Technique: Say It, Use It

For each gismu, say mi [gismu] aloud. This creates a mental link between the word and an action you can imagine yourself doing.

mi prami    — I love
mi klama    — I go
mi tavla    — I talk
mi citka    — I eat
mi pinxe    — I drink
mi cadzu    — I walk
mi ciska    — I write
mi tcidu    — I read
mi sipna    — I sleep
mi melbi    — I am beautiful
mi xamgu    — I am good
mi xlali    — I am bad

Say this list aloud three times. Speed up each time.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Lojban → English (Rapid Fire)

Translate as fast as you can. Don't write — just say the English aloud.

  1. prami
  2. sipna
  3. citka
  4. melbi
  5. klama
  6. xlali
  7. tavla
  8. xamgu
  9. pinxe
  10. ciska
  11. cadzu
  12. tcidu
Answers
  1. love
  2. sleep
  3. eat
  4. beautiful
  5. go
  6. bad
  7. talk
  8. good
  9. drink
  10. write
  11. walk
  12. read

Exercise 2: English → Lojban (Recall)

Now go the other direction. Say the Lojban aloud.

  1. walk
  2. good
  3. love
  4. read
  5. sleep
  6. bad
  7. drink
  8. talk
  9. beautiful
  10. write
  11. eat
  12. go
Answers
  1. cadzu
  2. xamgu
  3. prami
  4. tcidu
  5. sipna
  6. xlali
  7. pinxe
  8. tavla
  9. melbi
  10. ciska
  11. citka
  12. klama

Exercise 3: Sentence Building

Build a sentence for each prompt. Say it aloud.

  1. Say "I eat this."
  2. Say "You are beautiful."
  3. Say "This is bad."
  4. Say "I go. You sleep."
  5. Say "You talk to me. I love you."
Answers
  1. mi citka ti
  2. do melbi (or do cu melbi)
  3. ti xlali (or ti cu xlali)
  4. mi klama .i do sipna
  5. do tavla mi .i mi prami do

Exercise 4: Identify the Weak Spots

Which gismu did you hesitate on? Circle or note them mentally:

prami   klama   tavla   citka   pinxe   cadzu
ciska   tcidu   sipna   melbi   xamgu   xlali

For each weak word, create a sentence using it and say it three times.

items.text: Say "You talk to me. I love you."

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Describe your current state in Lojban. Say aloud:

  1. Are you hungry? → mi citka (I eat) or describe what you're doing
  2. Are you tired? → mi sipna (I sleep) — or about to
  3. Are you talking to someone? → mi tavla
  4. How are you? → mi xamgu or mi xlali

Now chain three true statements about yourself:

Example: mi tcidu .i mi pinxe ti .i mi xamgu (I read. I drink this. I am good.)

Say your chain aloud.

Matching Challenge

Draw lines (mentally or on paper) between the pairs:

Lojban English
1. prami a. walk
2. cadzu b. write
3. melbi c. love
4. ciska d. read
5. tcidu e. beautiful
Answers

1-c, 2-a, 3-e, 4-b, 5-d

Today's Vocab

No new vocabulary today. Focus on mastering what you've learned.

Self-assessment: Can you...

  • Say all 12 gismu from memory?
  • Give the English meaning for each?
  • Build a simple mi [gismu] do or mi [gismu] ti sentence?
  • Chain two sentences with .i?
  • Use cu correctly?

If any box is unchecked, review that section from earlier this week.

Summary

You drilled all 12 Week 1 gismu through rapid-fire translation, sentence building, and self-assessment. You identified your weak spots and practiced them. Vocabulary retention comes from repeated active recall — not passive reading.
